title: Kerala striving to create a model education system: Sivankutty
content: Thirty-one of the 100 complaints registered at the northern regional-level file clearance adalat for the higher secondary section settled

title: Police put several spas under scanner in Kozhikode
content: Flash inspections are under consideration in the wake of the rising number of complaints hinting at the illegal appointment of untrained non-Kerala women as skilled therapists

title: Tribals protest against eviction for sanctuary in Madhya Pradesh, Chouhan promises them justice
content: The forest department recently demolished more than 50 houses of members of the tribal community in Khivni Sanctuary in Dewas district, terming them as encroachment.

title: Varsities do not have permanent V-Cs because of Governors’ stubborn stance, says Bindu
content: Responding to High Court’s observation on lack of regular V-Cs in State’s varsities, Minister says Governors are increasingly interfering in matters concerning universities. Despite challenges, Kerala’s higher education sector has done well nationally and globally, she says

title: Inquiry ordered into allegations of thrashing by Peddapappur police
content: Order follows a video that went viral on social media platforms, where a youngster alleged that police thrashed him in the name of investigation

title: Kerala’s cancer incidence has gone much above the national average, oncologists and public health experts say
content: They call for targetted interventions to improve the awareness of risk factors for cancer and to encourage early diagnosis

title: Buoyed by BHEL’s strong order book,  new ancillary units spring up in Tiruchi and Pudukottai districts
content: The piling up of orders for boilers with BHEL by various State owned electricity boards and companies has changed the tide in favour of ancillary units

title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders to buy controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard
content: The development, of an Indian company acquiring controlling stakes at the facility located within the Colombo Port, comes amid New Delhi’s preoccupation with apparently growing Chinese outreach in the region

title: Investment has not grown because of Modi government’s policies of suppression, alleges Congress
content: Interest rates on savings account were at their lowest in 25 years, and household savings at their lowest in 50 years, with a consistent decline in the past three years, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge alleged

title: Kottayam becomes Kerala’s first district to eradicate extreme poverty
content: District reaches milestone through a structured, four-year-long process, says Minister Vasavan. Survey identified 903 individuals living in extreme poverty in the district and micro-plans were implemented to meet their needs

title: Fisheries college holds training on use of smart sensor technology for marketing packed fish
content: A training programme on the marketing of packed fishes using smart sensor technology was conducted on Saturday at Muttam, organised by the College of Fisheries Engineering, Nagapattinam.

title: Himachal Flash floods: Death toll climbs to seven as another body recovered from Kullu
content: Despite bad weather, joint search-and-rescue operations undertaken by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), police and home guards are underway to find four missing persons (two each in Kangra and Kullu districts), officials said.

title: Our priority is to speed up implementation of government schemes: Chief Minister Stalin
content: He says at least one family has benefitted from the schemes of the DMK government in the last four years

title: Ex-SIMI office-bearer Saquib Nachan dies in Delhi hospital
content: Saquib Nachan, ex-SIMI office-bearer and ISIS module accused, dies in Delhi hospital after brain haemorrhage

title: 16 two-wheelers inducted into Chittoor police fleet
content: New vehicles will play a vital role in removing traffic snarls and help in effective law enforcement, says SP

title: 41 years after Rakesh Sharma's 'saare jahan se acha', Shubhanshu Shukla calls India ...
content: In a historic moment, Axiom-4 pilot Shubhanshu Shukla echoed Rakesh Sharma's sentiments from space, declaring India "truly majestic." Interacting with PM Modi from the ISS, Shukla emphasized "oneness" and "Unity in Diversity," highlighting the absence of borders from space.

title: 'Gajar ka Halwa' in zero gravity: PM Modi shares a laugh with Shubhanshu Shukla during space call
content: PM Modi engaged in a cheerful video call with Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's newest space traveller, congratulating him on his historic achievement. Shukla shared that he brought 'gajar ka halwa', 'moong dal ka halwa', and 'aam ras' to share India's culinary heritage with his international teammates, who thoroughly enjoyed the treats.

title: Noida horror: Surprise check at old age home reveals harsh truths- locked, lonely, forgotten
content: An 80-year-old man, MG Singh, alleges mistreatment at a private old age home in Noida, claiming confinement and inadequate care. Following an inspection, the UP women's commission exposed troubling conditions at Anand Niketan. Staff admitted to using restraints on inmates, citing mental health issues and understaffing.

title: 'Secularism goes against Indian idea': Himanta backs call to remove words from Preamble
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma advocated for removing "secularism" and "socialism" from the Constitution's Preamble, echoing RSS's suggestion. He believes these terms, added during the Emergency, contradict India's principles of Sarva Dharma Sambhava and its economic vision. Sarma urged the government to eliminate these words, viewing them as legacies of the Emergency that Prime Minister Modi is working to erase.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: Big cheer for NRIs! Trump’s ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ reduces remittance tax to 1%
content: The final draft of the 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act' proposes a lower 1% tax on remittances. An earlier version suggested 3.5%. The United States is India's biggest remittance source.

title: 'Furthest from motherland, closest to Indian hearts': PM interacts with Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually interacted with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla on the ISS, congratulating him on behalf of India. Shukla expressed gratitude, highlighting the opportunities provided under Modi's leadership. He shared his experience of viewing Earth from space, emphasizing its unity and the absence of borders. Shukla also carried Indian desserts to share with his international crewmates.

title: 'Explosive-laden vehicle hit convoy': 16 Pakistan troops killed in suicide attack
content: A suicide attack, claimed by the Pakistani Taliban, targeted a military convoy in North Waziristan, resulting in the deaths of 16 soldiers and injuries to over two dozen individuals, including civilians. The bomber used an explosive-laden vehicle, causing significant damage and casualties.

title: US immigration authority to Visa applicants: Effective July 1, 2025, USCIS will no longer send ...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: Train control systems set for big upgrade! Railways prepares new blueprint
content: Indian Railways is set to overhaul its century-old train control systems, prioritizing safety and efficiency. The Railway Board plans to establish integrated command centers, replacing manual systems with advanced technology for better traffic management and crisis response.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; predicts it will lead world
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: Iyer not in Test contention yet, says ex-India cricketer: 'His time will come'
content: Despite Shreyas Iyer's impressive performances in the ICC Champions Trophy, IPL, and domestic red-ball season, Aakash Chopra suggests a Test call-up isn't imminent. Chopra highlights that players like Karun Nair, Sarfaraz Khan, and Dhruv Jurel are ahead in the queue.

title: Watch: PM Modi's ‘Jo humein chhedega’ remark draws loud applause at Jain event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi sparked excitement at a spiritual event by alluding to "Operation Sindoor," drawing cheers from the audience. He praised Acharya Vidyanand Maharaj Ji's contributions to Jain philosophy and highlighted the government's welfare policies inspired by spiritual figures. Modi also emphasized the promotion of mother tongues like Prakrit and the digitization of ancient Jain manuscripts.

title: India to welcome Pakistan; rivals placed in Pool B of Junior Men's Hockey World Cup
content: India is set to host the FIH Hockey Men's Junior World Cup in Chennai and Madurai from November 28 to December 10. The host nation finds itself in Pool B, facing Pakistan, Chile, and Switzerland. This edition marks a historic moment as the tournament expands to include 24 teams for the first time.

title: Watch: Paris hit by deadly thunderstorms; floodwaters rise near Eiffel Tower
content: Paris has been hit by severe thunderstorms and heavy rain since Wednesday, causing widespread flooding and damage. A viral video showed the Eiffel Tower illuminated amidst floodwaters as people sought shelter. Tragically, a 12-year-old boy and a 59-year-old motorcyclist died due to the storm's impact, with emergency responders handling over 300 calls and conducting numerous rescues.

title: ‘Orange alert’: Light rain brings relief to Delhi-NCR; IMD warns of thunderstorms
content: Delhi NCR experienced light rainfall on Saturday, bringing respite from the heat. The IMD has issued an orange alert, predicting thunderstorms and gusty winds with speeds of 30 to 50 kmph in the coming hours. While the minimum temperature was slightly above average, air quality remained in the 'satisfactory' category.

title: 'Totally pointless': Dutch no. 1 Giri reacts after Pragg becomes world no. 1 junior player
content: Anish Giri's witty remark on Praggnanandhaa becoming the World No.1 junior highlights the rise of young chess talents. Praggnanandhaa's UzChess Cup Masters 2025 victory, propelling him to World No.4 and India's top player, showcases his dominance. His dramatic win, praised by Viswanathan Anand, underscores his impressive character and solidifies his position as a leading force in chess.

title: Kolkata law college gangrape: Sukanta Majumdar detained during protest
content: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar was detained by police during a protest against an alleged gangrape at South Calcutta Law College. Majumdar criticized Mamata Banerjee's government for failing to ensure student safety following multiple crime reports from educational institutions, including the RG Kar Medical College rape case. He asserted the government's inability to maintain a safe environment disqualifies their right to govern.

title: Justin Bieber’s baby Jack melts hearts in Toronto Maple Leafs Jersey
content: Justin Bieber delighted fans by sharing photos of his son, Jack Blues Bieber, wearing an Auston Matthews Toronto Maple Leafs jersey. The images quickly went viral, with the team's official Instagram account showing their support. Bieber, a longtime celebrity fan of the Leafs, is passing on his passion for hockey to the next generation, creating a heartwarming moment for fans.

title: UP shocker: Navy personnel rapes woman after drugging her; filmed act
content: A Navy personnel in Kanpur has been accused of drugging and raping a woman under the false pretense of marriage. The accused, a friend of the victim's brother, allegedly took obscene photos and videos of her and threatened to release them when she insisted on marriage.

title: From cricket to Centre Court: How Wimbledon plans on wooing India
content: Wimbledon is targeting India to grow its brand, tapping into cricket’s popularity and engaging young audiences through collaborations, influencers, and technology. Indian cricketers like Virat Kohli, Sachin Tendulkar, and Rohit Sharma have become key figures in this strategy. With key partnerships, Wimbledon aims to blend tradition with innovation for global appeal.

title: Tatas suspend 4 after Air India SATS party video sparks outrage
content: Tata Group took swift disciplinary action, suspending four senior officials from Air India SATS and warning others, after a video surfaced showing executives partying shortly after the tragic June 12 Air India flight 171 crash. The celebration, held at the Gurugram office on June 20, sparked public outrage, with over 3.

title: Telangana tragedy: 6-year-old comes under tipper as mom tries to overtake from left
content: In Dundigal, a tragic accident occurred when a six-year-old boy, Abhimanyu Reddy, died after falling under a tipper truck while his mother, Niharika, was trying to overtake it on a scooter. Niharika lost control of the scooter, causing Abhimanyu to fall onto the road and under the vehicle's rear wheel.

title: Bihar shocker: Another wife kills husband with help of lover; runs Scorpio SUV over him
content: In Bihar's Aurangabad, a woman named Puja has been arrested for allegedly plotting with her lover, Kamlesh Yadav, to murder her husband, Bikku. Puja lured Bikku with the false promise of seeking medicine in Gayaji.

title: Former Manipur CM Biren Singh says efforts under way to form popular govt
content: Former Manipur CM N. Biren Singh stated that efforts are underway to establish a popular government in the state, emphasizing the BJP's commitment to restoring peace. He expressed optimism about forming a new government soon, highlighting the party's focus on resolving the ongoing crisis through collaboration with the central government and MLAs. Singh noted the absence of inter-community fighting in recent months, underscoring the importance of peace.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife in dance tribute for La La Anthony, honors Kobe Bryant & Michael Jordan
content: Ciara Princess Wilson celebrated her best friend La La Anthony's birthday with a stylish video, captivating fans from the NFL and NBA. The singer also shared moments from Fanatics Fest, including a heartfelt tribute to basketball legends Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant, highlighting her connections within the sports world and her enduring friendships.

title: 'No matter who's around' - Prasidh Krishna on Bumrah's absence
content: India faced a setback in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy's first Test against England, with coach Gautam Gambhir committed to managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, limiting him to three matches. Prasidh Krishna sees this as an opportunity, emphasizing team unity and learning from senior players like Bumrah.

title: Kolkata rape case: BJP forms committee; slams TMC for 'state-sponsored brutality'
content: BJP criticized the TMC government following a reported gangrape at a Kolkata law college, alleging the main accused's connection to TMC. Sambit Patra claimed the incident appeared state-sponsored due to the accused's TMC affiliation. BJP President JP Nadda formed a committee, including Satpal Singh and Meenakshi Lekhi, to investigate the matter and submit a report.

title: UP horror: YouTuber drugged, sexually assaulted by vlogger during shoot
content: A 17-year-old social media content creator was allegedly drugged and sexually assaulted by a video blogger during a shoot at a Gorakhpur club. The incident came to light after the girl's family filed a police complaint. Police have arrested the main accused, a Raptinagar resident, and are investigating the involvement of two others. The survivor is receiving mental health support.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi blames PM Modi for 'conspiring to strip Bihar of voting rights'
content: Tejashwi Yadav, RJD leader, accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of influencing the Election Commission to cancel Bihar's voter list and create a new one based on pre-1987 documents. He alleged this is a conspiracy to disenfranchise voters and deprive them of welfare benefits. Yadav stated he discussed the issue with opposition alliance members, ahead of the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah hits the nets as Team India focuses on bowling drills
content: Jasprit Bumrah's return to training has boosted India's bowling preparations for the Edgbaston Test after their Headingley defeat. Bumrah, Prasidh Krishna, and Mohammed Siraj bowled in the nets, injecting intensity into the team's practice. While Bumrah's inclusion remains uncertain due to workload management, his presence offers hope as Team India aims to level the series.

title: 'Dear Vladimir Kramnik, forgive me ...': Aronian writes after chess GM files defamation lawsuit
content: In a public plea, Armenian chess grandmaster Levon Aronian has urged Vladimir Kramnik, a former World Champion, to reconcile amidst a defamation lawsuit. Aronian's letter, shared on social media, expresses deep respect for Kramnik, acknowledging his significant influence. This follows Kramnik's lawsuit against Chessdom, GM David Navara, and others, stemming from disputes over alleged online cheating.

title: Axiom-4 mission: Crew settles in at ISS; Shubhanshu Shukla will sleep in 'Dragon'
content: Following their arrival at the International Space Station, the Axiom-4 crew, including Peggy Whitson, is being assisted by Expedition 73 in acclimating to the orbital environment and preparing for microgravity research. The crews are collaborating on unloading cargo, reviewing safety protocols, and familiarizing themselves with station systems. Expedition 73 is maintaining its research schedule while supporting the Axiom-4 mission.

title: Rescheduling chaos: Flyer says family split across 3 flights; 'had to change all plans'
content: Air India passengers are facing significant disruptions due to flight cancellations and schedule changes. Anish Agarwal's family's Toronto-Pune trip was split across multiple days, while a Pune family's Mumbai-Newark flight was abruptly cancelled, leading to re-routing. These issues stem from fleet reductions, causing international travelers to experience delays, extended layovers, and lack of compensation, sparking widespread frustration.

title: 'Barbados will forever be in my veins': Rohit relives India’s T20 WC 2024 glory
content: Rohit Sharma reminisces about India's triumphant ICC T20 World Cup 2024 victory, highlighting the thrilling final against South Africa and a tense, low-scoring match against Pakistan. He praises the team's resilience and the crucial performances of Bumrah, Arshdeep, and Pant. The victory ended a 17-year drought, creating unforgettable memories for the nation.

title: Iran buries top military commanders killed in Israel war; thousands join in funeral
content: Iran held a state funeral in Tehran for approximately 60 individuals, including military commanders and 14 nuclear scientists, who died in the conflict with Israel. The ceremony commenced in Islamic Revolution Square, attended by government officials and mourners waving Iranian flags. Among the deceased were Major General Mohammad Bagheri and nuclear scientist Mohammad Mehdi Tehranchi, both to be buried alongside their families.

title: 'Time to bring in Kuldeep Yadav': Ex-India cricketers drop big hint
content: Following their defeat in the first Test, India is contemplating changes for the second Test against England at Edgbaston. Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to workload management. Kuldeep Yadav's inclusion is strongly considered, given England's struggles against wrist spin.

title: ‘Nazi Ancestor Pass’: Derek O’Brien targets Election Commission over NRC
content: Derek O'Brien and Asaduddin Owaisi have strongly criticized the Election Commission of India's voter verification drive in Bihar and West Bengal. They allege it's a disguised attempt to implement the NRC, potentially disenfranchising many, especially the poor.

title: IND vs ENG | Yashasvi Jaiswal on brink of history, eyes 49-year-old record in Edgbaston
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal is on the verge of breaking Sunil Gavaskar's 49-year-old record to become the fastest Indian to reach 2000 Test runs. He needs just 97 runs in the upcoming Edgbaston Test against England to surpass Gavaskar, who achieved the milestone in 23 Tests. Jaiswal's recent century in Leeds has fueled anticipation for this historic feat.

title: $30bn for Iran nuclear program? 'Ridiculous idea', says Trump; dismisses report
content: Donald Trump has vehemently denied reports suggesting his administration considered a $30 billion deal to aid Iran in developing a civil nuclear program. He dismissed the reports as "fake news" and a "hoax" intended to demean him.

title: Campus safety in focus: Law college gangrape triggers RG Kar case memories
content: A 24-year-old law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped on her college campus by an ex-student leader and two junior students. The survivor reported the assault occurred after she rejected a marriage proposal, leading to her abduction and sexual assault in a security room.

title: Corporation decides to install odour control system  as residents raise a stink over decanting station at Khajamalai in Tiruchi
content: The system would trap gaseous pollutants such as hydrogen sulphide, in activated carbon filters, releasing clean air; it removes impurities and contaminants by passing them through activated carbon

title: Assam Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi draws PM Modi’s attention to irregularities in dairy project
content: Gaurav Gogoi says firms linked to BJP leaders, including a Minister, were beneficiaries through favouritism

title: Health officials told to step up measures to counter seasonal diseases
content: State Commissioner of Family Welfare informs officials to adopt and enforce focused strategies to fight malaria, dengue, chikungunya, and diarrhoeal infections

title: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik takes swipe at BJP government over delay in Rath Yatra rituals
content: In addition to the delay, hospitalisation of 700 devotees due to a stampede-like situation and heat exhaustion in Puri was said to be upshoot of mismanagement of event

title: Dravidian University in Kuppam launches engineering college with approval from Andhra Pradesh government
content: The initiative, supported by Chief Minister and Kuppam MLA N. Chandrababu Naidu, paves the way for the university to expand higher education options at the tri-State Kuppam Junction

title: Engineering students in Kottayam turn classroom project into patented innovation
content: The team from Saintgits College of Engineering develop myoelectric prosthetic hand using plant fibre. The device operates by detecting electrical signals generated by muscles in the human body, allowing it to perform hand-like movements.

title: Weddings, interrupted
content: Incidents of violence have been reported from pockets of Uttar Pradesh against Dalit families for holding wedding processions. In most cases, people from upper caste communities have objected to a baraat, a man getting on a horse to go to his bride, or a DJ playing music. Samridhi Tewari reports on how Dalits are using weddings as a form of resistance

title: PM Modi interacts with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s journey marked the first space journey by an Indian astronaut in 41 years since Rakesh Sharma flew aboard a Russian spacecraft

title: Bar Council welcomes move to set up special training academy for advocates
content: It wants the government to name it either after first Chief Minister of Andhra  Tanguturi Prakasam or first Chief Justice of India from the Telugu community Koka Subba Rao

title: DYFI supports Zumba classes in Kerala schools
content: Bid to create communal discord in society and destroy the secular fabric of Kerala, says DYFI State secretary V.K. Sanoj.

title: Decrepit government medical college building in need of a major surgery
content: Shaded entrance to the college auditorium serves more as a car parking spot;  signage is damaged while seats and other furnishings inside appeared to be falling apart

title: ED seizes ₹1.37 crore cash during search proceedings on three engineering colleges allegedly involved in seat blocking scam
content: ED seizes ₹1.37 crore in cash during Bengaluru seat-blocking scam raids, uncovering widespread money laundering activities in colleges

title: Academicians should play key role to make India self-reliant, says NITI Aayog Member V.K. Saraswat
content: ‘Centre has increased spending on Research and Development to over ₹1.27 lakh crore under the mission Viksit Bharat-2047’

title: Kolkata Police form five-member SIT to probe into gang rape of law college student
content: "An SIT has been formed to probe into the alleged crime. It will start its investigation immediately," the officer said.

title: Chirag seeks President's rule in West Bengal after gang rape of Kolkata student
content: "Even after 75 years of Independence, the state reports electoral violence, more than any other province," Chirag Paswan alleged

title: Assam CM Himanta says 'socialism, secularism' can be removed from Constitution
content: "How can I be secular? I am a hardcore Hindu. A Muslim person is a hardcore Muslim person. How can he be secular?" Mr. Sarma said.

title: Supreme Court orders release of law student from preventive detention under NSA, says ‘wholly untenable’
content: Petitioner Annu alias Aniket was booked by police following an altercation at a university campus in Betul, allegedly after he clashed with a professor

title: Accused have TMC links, Mamata should apologise, resign: BJP on Kolkata student gang-rape case
content: BJP demands accountability from Mamata Banerjee over gang-rape incident in Kolkata, accusing all accused of TMC affiliation

title: NCW Chairperson writes to Bengal Chief Secretary over south Kolkata law college gang-rape
content: The commission has also sought an immediate and confidential internal medical examination of the survivor and asked that both internal and external medical reports be submitted to the NCW within three days.

title: Article 370 was against Ambedkar's ideology of one Constitution for united India: CJI Gavai
content: The CJI said the Supreme Court drew inspiration from Dr. Ambedkar's vision of a united India under a single constitution while upholding the Centre's decision to abrogate Article 370

title: Ministry of Railways announces express train connecting Tirupati, Chikkamagaluru
content: Initially, the train would operate weekly, and in future it will be increased to thrice a week, says MP Kota Shrinivas Poojari

title: M.G.R.’s aide Mahalingam dies at 73
content: He became the former Chief Minister’s aide in 1972 and continued in the position till the latter’s death in December 1987

title: India most ancient living civilisation due to immortal ideas, philosophy of seers: PM Modi
content: PM Modi was speaking at the centenary celebrations of Jain spiritual figure Acharya Vidyanand Maharaj Ji’s birth anniversary

title: Palaniswami is NDA’s chief ministerial candidate for 2026 T.N. Assembly polls: G.K. Vasan
content: Speaking to reporters on the sidelines of a party function in Salem, Mr. Vasan said there were no issues within the NDA and that it remained a “strong and victorious alliance”

title: Padma Sasidhar is new director for A.P. Public Health and Family Welfare
content: Dr. Sasidhar’s appointment is part of the overhaul of the health department, during which more than 7,000 healthcare and supporting staff were transferred.

title: Andhra Pradesh BJP president election on July 1
content: The notification for it would be issued on June 29, with June 30 as the deadline for filing nominations

title: From Korukonda to Kaliningrad: exemplary journey of a Sainik School product
content: Capt. Sridhar will be the first Saikorian to have the unique distinction of leading a team of 250 Naval personnel in accepting and inducting the ship

title: Schools in Mysuru to take up ‘Beat Plastic Pollution’ campaign
content: Students will be asked to collect discarded plastic pieces and deposit the same at a designated place in the school

title: Efforts underway to form popular government in Manipur: Biren Singh
content: The former Chief Minister said the Central government is working day and night to restore peace in Manipur

title: FIR against MP Congress chief Patwari for forcing man to make false claim
content: Patwari said the FIR exposed the “dictatorship” of the ruling forces and their efforts to suppress the voice of the victims

title: Preamble of Constitution ‘not changeable’ but was changed during Emergency, claims V-P Dhankhar
content: The Vice-President said that the words "socialist", "secular" and "integrity" were added in 1976, backing the claim made by RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale

title: Search operation to trace three JeM terrorists in J&K’s Basantgarh enters third day
content: A Pakistan-based JeM terrorist was killed in an encounter with security forces on June 26, while three of his associates remain trapped in the forested area of the Basantgarh belt

title: M.A. Baby reveals the only time when Sitaram Yechury overruled CPI(M)‘s diktat
content: Describing Sitaram Yechury as a Marxist with a keen interest in multiple subjects, CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby said he always tried to gain an in-depth knowledge in all of them

title: Police attacked, vehicles damaged during drug party raid in Kerala’s Thrissur
content: The first patrol team that arrived was ambushed by the gang hiding nearby. Subsequently, two more police vehicles were also attacked

title: Watch: In conversation with award-winning chef Vijay Kumar, of ‘Semma’, New York
content: Set in the heart of Manhattan, Semma is the first Indian restaurant to top the New York Times’ 100 best restaurants list

title: Gadchiroli district, four taluks in Gondia remain 'Naxal-infested': Maharashtra Government
content: A Government Resolution stated that Gondia, Salekasa, Devri and Arjuni Morgaon taluks in Gondia district and the entire Gadchiroli district are ‘Naxal-infested’

title: Railway Ministry regularises services of Vijayapura-Mangaluru Central-Vijayapura Express Special
content: ‘This move will benefit patients from North Karnataka seeking medical care in Mangaluru, students pursuing education in coastal districts and regular passengers,’ says Dakshina Kannada MP Brijesh Chowta

title: Newly-elected MLA from Ludhiana West Sanjeev Arora administered oath by Punjab Vidhan Sabha Speaker
content: Arora had defeated Congress candidate Bharat Bhushan Ashu by a margin of 10,637 votes in the Ludhiana West Assembly bypoll

title: The best, worst and most surprising of the NBA draft: Favorite picks, classes and rookie-year predictions
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Sources: Wolves' Reid to sign 5-year, $125M deal
content: Naz Reid intends to sign a five-year, $125 million contract to remain with the Timberwolves, sources told ESPN.

title: Schaefer goes No. 1 to Isles; Misa, Frondell follow
content: The Islanders selected gifted defenseman Matthew Schaefer, 17, with the No. 1 pick in the NHL draft Friday night. Center Michael Misa went second to the Sharks, and the Blackhawks took Swedish forward Anton Frondell third.

title: Pegula handles Swiatek to win Bad Homburg title
content: Jessica Pegula contained Iga Swiatek's heavy topspin game on grass to earn a 6-4, 7-5 victory on Saturday and lift the Bad Homburg Open title.

title: Mercury set WNBA record for 3s over 2 games
content: The Mercury finished 18 of 39 from beyond the arc against the Liberty, a game after hitting 17 3s in a win over Chicago. The 35 3s over consecutive games is a WNBA record.

title: Panthers keep playoff MVP Bennett on 8-year deal
content: The Panthers signed Conn Smythe winner Sam Bennett to an eight-year extension worth $64 million on Friday night, hours before the start of the NHL draft.

title: Bailey to report to Jazz on Saturday, team says
content: Ace Bailey, the No. 5 pick in the NBA draft Wednesday, plans to report to the Utah Jazz as expected Saturday, a team representative told ESPN on Friday.

title: Marte says fan shouted he messaged late mother
content: Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte said a fan in Chicago who brought him to tears during a game against the White Sox this week shouted that he messaged his late mother the previous night.

title: BYU QB Retzlaff denies woman's rape allegations
content: BYU quarterback Jake Retzlaff responded to a woman's allegations that he raped, strangled and bit her in 2023, calling them "ridiculous and bizarre."

title: 🏀 2026 NBA mock draft: Four top prospects
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: NHL draft tracker: Schaefer selected at No. 1, Misa goes No. 2 and more as Flames close out Round 1
content: Here is a list of every selection, including detailed analysis for the top 32 picks from Friday night at the NHL draft.

title: What we're hearing about Luka, LeBron and the Lakers' offseason

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: No boxing, no love: Which version of Chavez Jr. shows up against Paul?
content: The 39-year-old risks the possibility of further damaging the credibility of the last name made famous by his father, Julio Sr.

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Jake Paul discusses his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: Wrexham coach: Mullin made decision to leave
content: Wrexham coach Phil Parkinson has told ESPN that Paul Mullin's loan move to Wigan was the player's decision.

title: Spain's Bonmati hospitalized with viral meningitis
content: Two-time Ballon d'Or winner and Spain national team star Aitana Bonmatí has been hospitalized with viral meningitis just six days before the start of the Euro 2025.

title: Sources: Brentford reject Man Utd's Mbeumo bid
content: Brentford have rejected an overall package worth £62.5 million ($85.7 million) for Bryan Mbeumo from Manchester United, sources told ESPN.

title: Madrid's Alaba out of CWC after injury setback
content: Real Madrid defender David Alaba will miss the remainder of the Club World Cup due to a new injury, extending his sidelined time this season after a knee injury.

title: Sources: USMNT's Agyemang close to Derby move
content: Charlotte FC and USMNT striker Patrick Agyemang is closing in on a transfer to Derby County for a fee of $7 million, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: USMNT's Weah rejects Forest deal
content: Nottingham Forest have ended their interest in Tim Weah after the United States striker rejected the club's contract proposal, sources told ESPN.

title: Guardiola: Grealish omission not due to behavior
content: Pep Guardiola has rejected the suggestion that Jack Grealish's omission from the Manchester City squad has anything to do with his off-field behaviour.

title: Sources: Giroud to join Lille as LAFC confirms exit
content: Olivier Giroud will join French club Lille this summer, sources have told ESPN, after LAFC confirmed it had agreed to terminate the French striker's contract.

title: Will the USMNT's star absentees hurt their hopes for the 2026 World Cup?
content: Christian Pulisic, Weston McKennie, Antonee Robinson, Sergiño Dest: the U.S. has none of them at the Gold Cup. Is that damaging to their World Cup prep?

title: The NFL's most team- and player-friendly contracts at six positions: Who makes the list?

content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Kupcho, Maguire shoot best-ball 60, lead Dow

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: England won the Women's Euros in 2022 and will attempt to retain it this summer, but before the fun gets started, let's run through the tournament's memorable moments.

title: "16 Sunsets, 16 Sunrises": Shubhanshu Shukla To PM On Life On ISS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday spoke to Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla of the Indian Air Force - the man who created history earlier this week by becoming the first Indian to enter the International Space Station (ISS).

title: In Mid-Air Drama, Air India Flyer Abuses Passenger Minutes Before Landing
content: Unruly scenes were witnessed mid-air after a passenger reportedly misbehaved with another flyer on board an Air India flight from Amritsar to Delhi today. The incident happened when preparations were underway for landing, Air India said.

title: Elon Musk Says First Tesla Drove Itself From Factory to Customer
content: Elon Musk said a Tesla Model Y SUV drove itself from the company's factory near Austin to a customer's home in the company's latest move to showcase its push into autonomous driving.

title: Marks Around Neck, Chest: NDTV Accesses Kolkata Rape Case Medical Report
content: The medical examination of the 24-year-old law student who was allegedly raped inside a law college in Kolkata on June 25 has confirmed multiple signs of physical assault.

title: Woman Kills Pet Dog In 'Tantric' Ritual, Decomposed Body Found At Bengaluru Home
content: Some objects were also found in the apartment, prompting the authorities to investigate a black magic angle.

title: 4,500-Year-Old Civilisation In Rajasthan Has Mythical River Saraswati Link
content: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has unearthed evidence of a civilisation dating back 4,500 years in Bahaj village of Deeg district, Rajasthan.

title: ISIS India Head Saquib Nachan Dies In Hospital After Brain Haemorrhage
content: Saquib Nachan, head of the so-called Islamic State's (ISIS) India operations and former office-bearer of the banned Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI), died in Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital Saturday afternoon after suffering a brain haemorrhage.

title: "Priceless Memories": Gautam Adani Feels "Blessed" To Witness Puri Rath Yatra
content: Gautam Adani, the Chairman of the Adani Group, on Saturday said he feels blessed to have had the privilege of witnessing the divine Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath.

title: Pre-Monsoon Rain In Parts Of Delhi, Nearby Areas, Brings Down Heat
content: Delhi and its neighbouring regions experienced heavy rainfall today, following days of scorching heat and humidity.

title: DNA Test Identifies Last Victim Of Ahmedabad Crash, Death Count Stands At 260
content: More than two weeks after the Ahmedabad plane crash, the DNA test has ascertained the identity of the last victim, and the death toll in the tragedy now stands at 260, officials said on Saturday.

title: Senior IPS Officer Parag Jain, Who Played Key Role In Op Sindoor, To Head RAW: Source
content: Senior IPS officer Parag Jain, credited with key intelligence operations during Operation Sindoor, has been appointed as the new head of the country's external intelligence agency, the Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), sources have told NDTV.

title: Biker Chases Delhi Car Driver For 3 Km, Shatters Windows, Leaves Him Bleeding
content: A man suffered injuries from broken glass after a two-wheeler rider chased him for nearly 3 km and smashed both front windows of his car, as well as the rear windshield, with a brick in Delhi.

title: Gautam Adani, Family Attend Grand Jagannath Rath Yatra In Puri
content: Industrialist Gautam Adani and members of his family were present in Odisha's Puri today to attend the annual Rath Yatra, one of India's most significant religious festivals.

title: Why Republicans Want Donald Trump To Revoke Zohran Mamdani's US Citizenship
content: Indian-origin candidate Zohran Mamdani and a Democratic socialist emerged with a commanding lead in the Democratic mayoral primary, over former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who conceded late Tuesday.

title: On Camera: 9 Swept Away In Flash Floods In Pak, Outing Turns Tragic For Family
content: A picnic outing turned tragic for a family in Pakistan after nine out of 18 members of the group lost their lives in the Swat River flash floods. The incident occurred in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province on Friday.

title: Lauren Sanchez Wipes Instagram Posts, Changes Name After Marrying Jeff Bezos
